lines.text: Flourish. Enter the DUKE of Florence, BERTRAM, PAROLLES, Soldiers, Drum, and Trumpets

lines.speaker: duke
lines.text: The general of our horse thou art; and we, Great in our hope, lay our best love and credence Upon thy promising fortune.

lines.speaker: bertram
lines.text: Sir, it is A charge too heavy for my strength, but yet We'll strive to bear it for your worthy sake To the extreme edge of hazard.

lines.speaker: duke
lines.text: Then go thou forth; And fortune play upon thy prosperous helm, As thy auspicious mistress!

lines.speaker: bertram
lines.text: This very day, Great Mars, I put myself into thy file: Make me but like my thoughts, and I shall prove A lover of thy drum, hater of love.
